statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -1 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 3 \\ -1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ -6 \\ 12 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -19 \\ -11 \\ 27 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -1 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 3 \\ -1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ -6 \\ 12 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -19 \\ -11 \\ 27 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
